isis.stitle: ALTERNATOR: DELCO-REMY 30-SI AND 30-SI/TR SERIES - TROUBLESHOOTING - 30-SI/TR SERIES

svcsubproc.title: Undercharged Battery
svcsubproc.para: If either battery is undercharged, observe the following procedure:

important.para: Do not allow leads or terminals to touch ground!

step1.para: Completely remove the TR unit from the 30-SI generator as follows:

step2.para: Pull TR unit away from 30-SI generator to expose lead connections.
Detach three transformer leads from the three studs on the 30-SI rectifier bridge. Reassemble nuts onto 30-SI rectifier bridge studs.
Detach remaining TR single lead from 30-SI rectifier bridge heat sink. Reattach screw (some units don't use this lead).

step1.para: The circuit is now a regular 12-volt 30-SI charging system connected to the "S" battery.
Check the system as instructed in 30-SI, 3.4., Undercharged Battery, in this section.
If a defect is found, repair as required and reinstall the TR unit.
If no defect is found, check the rectifier bridge on the TR unit as follows:
Disconnect transformer leads from rectifier bridge. Connect the ohmmeter to a heat sink and one of the three terminals (Step A, Figure 11). Then reverse the lead connections to the same terminal.

figure.caption: Ohmmeter Checks of Transformer and Rectifier Bridge Diodes in TR Unit

step1.para: If both readings are the same, replace the rectifier bridge by detaching the necessary screws and nuts. A good rectifier bridge will give one high and one low reading. Repeat this same test between the same heat sink and the other two terminals, and between the other heat sink and each of the three terminals. This makes a total of six checks, with two readings taken for each check. If rectifier bridge is constructed with flat metal clips at the three studs, press down very firmly onto flat metal clips and not onto threaded stud.

svcsubproc.para: When replacing rectifier bridge, note stack-up of parts so unit can be properly reassembled. For negative ground systems, bridge is assembled with long cooling fins next to end frame, and short fins next to transformer, as shown in Figure 11.

step1.para: Check the transformer on the TR unit as follows:
Connect ohmmeter three ways as shown in Step B, Step C and Step D, Figure 11. Each reading should be very high (infinite). If not, replace transformer.
Reinstall the TR unit onto the 30-SI generator.
Detach 24-volt lead from generator.

note.para: Do not allow lead to touch ground.

step1.para: Connect ammeter between 24-volt TR terminal and disconnected lead.
Connect a 5-20-ampere load, such as one or two 12-volt headlamps across the 12-volt cranking or "C" battery.
Operate generator at speed sufficient to produce maximum output.
TR unit output to "C" battery and load should be 5 amperes or more. If less than 5 amperes, replace transformer.
If 5 amperes or more, TR unit is not defective, and it will charge "C" battery when engine is run a sufficient length of time.

If either battery is overcharged, or if both batteries are overcharged, check the overcharged battery for defects. Remember that an overheated battery may be overcharged even though no charging circuit defects are present.
If battery is not defective or overheated, connect a voltmeter between alternator 12-volt terminal and ground.
With all accessories turned off, increase engine speed as required to obtain maximum voltage reading.
If voltage exceeds 15 volts, remove alternator for repair as covered under REPAIR PROCEDURES. The TR unit itself cannot cause overcharge, so it need not be checked.
